text: Anyone changed HubSpot date field form with js? I’ve tried the jquery change function with a date field in HubSpot form but it gets cleared constantly.
you have to trigger a keypress or certain other event if I remember right. The forms use react so if you don’t trigger it like a person would it wont see the change

Yep I need to trigger change event using jquery based on HubSpot documentation on that. It is all fine on pretty much everything else except when I try to fill value into a date property. For some reason it gets the value but then after a short moment it goes empty >.<

hmm, yea, seems like it’s not recognizing the change trigger then.  ’fraid I’m not sure what to tell ya. one option you could do is make the date field a text field, then apply your date picker to that. text inputs do properly support change
Yea I’m throwing all sorts of curveballs at this I’ll get it sorted soon surely. Had to check if anyone got some ready neat way to tackle this. Thanks Jon!
<@U7WV8C5LN> what are you trying to set the value to?  If you are trying to set it a datetime that likely won’t work since it’s not a datetime but just date picker

Yea I’ve figured that HubSpot seems to at least on some parts use Pikaday for the datepicker. I got everything working fine but then ran into an issue that I guess makes me backtrack a little and approach this with a different way since on mobile devices datepicker is ditched and the devices own native datepicker is used

<@U7SL518D6>, I am getting a console JS error on my HTML template:
Uncaught ReferenceError: _hsq is not defined, do you know why this is or how to resolve it?
looks like it’s referring to the HubSpot tracking code. not sure why you’d be getting that error
I have the HS standard headers and footers in the html template and just basic HTML/CSS and JS code in there
then your js code may have an error
